item.title: BASES FOR INTERPERSONALISM
item.description:
BASES FOR INTERPERSONALISM

I. What Is Most Original (the [inter]personal character of ultimate reality)

A. God created the universe out of nothing.

Godâ€™s creatorship means that the material, inorganic, impersonal universe is secondary to the (inter)personal creator. God spoke the universe into existence (Genesis 1:3, 6, 9, 11, 14, 20, 24, 26, 29; Hebrews 11:3; 2 Peter 3:5). Its origin came from an act of the will (Acts 17:22-31), not from determinism through physical cause-effect. It was created (John 1:1-3; Colossians 1:14-20), not out of God, but by him from nothing else.
